byline.contributor: Maggy Ayala reported from Quito, and Nicholas Casey from Puerto La Cruz, Venezuela. Christopher Mele, Rick Gladstone and Karen Zraick contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MAGGY AYALA and NICHOLAS CASEY

abstract: At least 246 people are dead and 2,527 injured after 7.8-magnitude earthquake hits central coastal region of Ecuador; Pres Rafael Correa declares state of emergency and mobilizes 4,600 national police and 10,400 members of armed forces to aid in rescue and recovery efforts.

headline.print_headline: Ecuador Reels in ‘Anguish and Pain’ After Quake Kills Hundreds
headline.main: Scenes of Ruin After Ecuador Earthquake Kills Hundreds

snippet: More than 2,500 people were injured, the government said, in an earthquake that devastated a large swath of the Ecuadorean coast.
lead_paragraph: More than 2,500 people were injured, the government said, in an earthquake that devastated a large swath of the Ecuadorean coast.
